Validate inputs for run_hatsa_core

Source: R/utils.R
validate_hatsa_inputs.Rd

Checks the validity of input parameters for the main HATSA function. Stops with an error if validation fails.

Usage

validate_hatsa_inputs(
  subject_data_list,
  anchor_indices,
  spectral_rank_k,
  k_conn_pos,
  k_conn_neg,
  n_refine,
  V_p
)

Arguments

subject_data_list

A list of matrices, where each matrix `X_i` is `T_i x V_p` (time points by parcels) for subject `i`.

anchor_indices

A numeric vector of 1-based indices for anchor parcels.

spectral_rank_k

An integer, the spectral rank `k`. Must be `>= 0`.

k_conn_pos

An integer, number of positive connections for sparsification.

k_conn_neg

An integer, number of negative connections for sparsification.

n_refine

An integer, number of GPA refinement iterations.

V_p

An integer, the number of parcels (columns in `subject_data_list` elements).

Value

Invisibly returns a list containing potentially modified `anchor_indices` (uniquified) if validation passes.
